name: clifm
description: ðŸ’¾ The shell-like, command line terminal file manager
readme_summary: Clifm is a shell-like, command-line file manager written in C. It provides powerful file management capabilities directly within the terminal, without relying on a graphical or text-based user interface, making it highly compatible with various terminal environments.
key_features: Bookmarks, search, file selection, tags, filters
High compatibility with old terminals (VT102, Rxvt, DEC-VT100)
primary_use_case: To provide a powerful and efficient file management experience directly within the command line interface, suitable for users who prefer terminal-based workflows and need compatibility with minimal terminal environments.
cover_image_prompt: A seasoned explorer confidently navigating a dense, ancient jungle using only a highly detailed, illuminated map and a compass. The map is not paper, but a glowing, interactive digital interface projected from a small, sleek device held by the explorer, displaying paths, points of interest, and potential shortcuts. The jungle represents the complex file system, and the explorer's focused actions symbolize efficient file management. Subtle digital particles emanate from the map, hinting at the underlying technology. The scene is rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style, with a focus on clear visual storytelling and a color palette of earthy tones contrasted with the map's vibrant glow. The repository name 'clifm' is subtly etched onto the explorer's device.

name: museeks
description: ðŸŽµ A simple, clean and cross-platform music player
readme_summary: Museeks is a simple, clean, and cross-platform music player built with Electron and React. It focuses on core music playback features like library management, playlists, queue control, and playback speed adjustments, offering a straightforward user experience on Linux, macOS, and Windows.
key_features: Supported audio formats: mp3, mp4, m4a/aac, flac, wav, ogg, 3gpp
primary_use_case: A user-friendly, cross-platform desktop application for playing and managing music collections.
cover_image_prompt: A minimalist, serene digital landscape where a stylized, glowing music note acts as a conductor's baton. This baton is orchestrating a flow of diverse audio waveforms and album art icons, transforming them into a clear, harmonious stream of organized sound waves. Subtle UI elements resembling a clean music player interface are integrated into the landscape's natural features. The scene is bathed in soft, ambient light, with a color palette of cool blues and purples, evoking a sense of calm and order. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration, emphasizing clarity and a modern aesthetic, with the name 'Museeks' subtly etched into a floating platform.

name: termux-desktop
description: Install a full Linux desktop environment on your Android device with Termux X11 ( VNC optional) and also enable hardware acceleration
readme_summary: Termux-Desktop is a shell script designed to easily install and manage Linux desktop environments and window managers within the Termux environment on Android devices. It supports various desktop styles, enables hardware acceleration, and offers options for GUI access via Termux:X11 or VNC, along with package management and containerization capabilities.
key_features: Multiple Desktop Styles (Xfce, LXQt, Openbox, etc.)
GUI Access via Termux:X11 (default) or VNC (optional)
Package Management with APT and optional PACMAN
App Store for easy application installation
primary_use_case: To install and run a full Linux desktop environment on an Android device using Termux, enabling a graphical user interface and hardware acceleration.
cover_image_prompt: A vibrant digital painting of an Android smartphone transforming into a compact, futuristic desktop computer. From the phone's screen, a miniature, fully functional Linux desktop environment (like Xfce or LXQt) is emerging, complete with windows, icons, and a taskbar. Subtle glowing lines connect the phone's hardware components to the desktop interface, symbolizing hardware acceleration. Small, stylized icons representing Termux:X11 and VNC are visible on the phone's display. The overall mood is innovative and empowering, showcasing the seamless integration of a desktop experience onto a mobile device. The repository name 'Termux-Desktop' is subtly integrated into the phone's design.

name: open-scouts
description: AI-powered web monitoring platform. Create automated scouts that search the web and send email alerts when they find what you're looking for.
readme_summary: Open Scouts is an AI-powered web monitoring platform that allows users to create automated 'scouts' to continuously search the web for specific information. When a scout finds the desired content, it sends an email notification to the user, ensuring they stay updated on relevant changes or new information.
key_features: Create AI scouts for automated web searching
Receive email alerts upon finding target information
Vector embeddings for semantic search on execution summaries
primary_use_case: Automated web monitoring and notification for specific information discovery.
cover_image_prompt: A vigilant digital librarian, represented as a wise owl with glowing eyes, meticulously sifting through a vast, swirling ocean of digital information (represented by glowing data streams and web pages). The owl uses a magnifying glass that highlights specific keywords and phrases, transforming them into elegant, illuminated scrolls. As the owl finds relevant information, it places it into a neatly organized digital inbox, from which a gentle stream of email icons flows outwards to a waiting user depicted as a silhouette. The scene is set in a futuristic, organized library with subtle UI elements showing search queries and notification counts. The overall mood is one of diligent discovery and efficient notification. 3D isometric illustration style, clean lines, vibrant but focused color palette.

name: openscreen
description: Create stunning screen recordings for free. Open-source, no subscriptions, no watermarks, and free for commercial use. An alternative to Screen Studio.
readme_summary: OpenScreen is a free, open-source desktop application for creating high-quality screen recordings and product demos. It offers essential features like screen/app recording, customizable zooms, annotations, and background customization, serving as a simpler alternative to paid software like Screen Studio.
key_features: Record whole screen or specific apps
Add manual zooms with customizable depth, duration, and position
Choose backgrounds (wallpapers, solid colors, gradients, custom images)
Apply motion blur for smoother effects
Export in various aspect ratios and resolutions
primary_use_case: Creating product demos, tutorials, and walkthrough videos with customizable screen recordings.
cover_image_prompt: A digital artist meticulously crafting a beautiful, floating video frame from raw screen capture footage. The artist uses tools resembling a magic wand to add animated zooms and glowing annotation elements like arrows and text bubbles directly onto the video. The background is a clean, minimalist studio with subtle UI elements showing recording controls and export options. The overall mood is creative and empowering, with soft, focused lighting. The scene should be in a 3D isometric illustration style, emphasizing clarity and ease of use, with the name 'OpenScreen' subtly integrated into a digital canvas.
